text:
At the top of the online Ant manual, it says:

"This is the manual for version 1.8.1 of Apache Ant. If your version of Ant (as verified with ant -version) is older or newer than this version then this is not the correct manual set. Please use the documentation appropriate to your current version."

That's not particularly helpful unless there's a way to get to the documentation for previous versions.  For people who installed from source, that's not a big deal, but for people who get the software preinstalled as part of an OS, that documentation is often unavailable without hunting down an old copy of the source tarball and extracting it.

Also, the installed manual pages for things like build.xml(5) contain links to the HTML manual, but link directly to the latest version.  It would be useful for those man pages to link to the online HTML manual appropriate for a given version of the tool.
creator: dgatwood@mac.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
We've added the manual as a new type of distribution, see http://ant.apache.org/manualdownload.cgi and created archives for 1.6.5 to 1.8.0 as well.

We do not provide the man pages ourselves so don't have any influence on them.
